intro: Liberatia chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean liberatia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Chile. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in coastal environments with moderate temperatures. It is often found in association with other coastal flora, contributing to the biodiversity of the region. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
